API¶

class idesolver.IDESolver(x, y_0: float, c: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, d: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, k: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, f: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, lower_bound: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, upper_bound: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, global_error_tolerance: float = 1e-09, interpolation_kind: str = 'cubic', max_iterations: typing.Union[str, NoneType] = None, smoothing_factor: float = 0.5)[source]¶

A class that handles solving an integro-differential equation of the form

\[\begin{split}\frac{dy}{dx} & = c(y, x) + d(x) \int_{\alpha(x)}^{\beta(x)} k(x, s) \, F( y(s) ) \, ds, \\ & x \in [a, b], \quad y(a) = y_0.\end{split}\]
Parameters:
  • x (numpy.ndarray) – The array of \(x\) values to find the solution \(y(x)\) at. Generally something like numpy.linspace(a, b, num_pts).
  • y_0 (float) – The initial condition, \(y_0 = y(a)\).
  • c (callable) – The function \(c(y, x)\).
  • d (callable) – The function \(d(x)\).
  • k (callable) – The kernel function \(k(x, s)\).
  • f (callable) – The function \(F(y)\).
  • lower_bound (callable) – The lower bound function \(\alpha(x)\).
  • upper_bound (callable) – The upper bound function \(\beta(x)\).
  • global_error_tolerance (float) –
  • interpolation_kind (str) – The type of interpolation to use. As the kind option of scipy.interpolate.interp1d. Defaults to 'cubic'.
  • max_iterations (int) – The maximum number of iterations to use. If None, iteration will not stop unless the global_error_tolerance is satisfied. Defaults to None.
  • smoothing_factor (float) – The smoothing factor used to combine the current guess with the new guess at each iteration. Defaults to 0.5.
solve() → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Compute the solution to the IDE.

The solution is returned, and also stored in the attribute y.

Returns:
Return type:The solution to the IDE.
class idesolver.CIDESolver(x, y_0: float, c: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, d: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, k: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, f: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, lower_bound: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, upper_bound: typing.Union[typing.Callable, NoneType] = None, global_error_tolerance: float = 1e-09, interpolation_kind: str = 'cubic', max_iterations: typing.Union[str, NoneType] = None, smoothing_factor: float = 0.5)[source]¶

Bases: idesolver.solver.IDESolver

This class uses a different set of solvers and a definition of the global error function appropriate for complex \(y\). Because it needs to use a complex-valued data type and a complex-valued ODE solver, this solver is slower than the real-valued IDESolver.

Parameters:
  • x (numpy.ndarray) – The array of \(x\) values to find the solution \(y(x)\) at. Generally something like numpy.linspace(a, b, num_pts).
  • y_0 (float) – The initial condition, \(y_0 = y(a)\).
  • c (callable) – The function \(c(y, x)\).
  • d (callable) – The function \(d(x)\).
  • k (callable) – The kernel function \(k(x, s)\).
  • f (callable) – The function \(F(y)\).
  • lower_bound (callable) – The lower bound function \(\alpha(x)\).
  • upper_bound (callable) – The upper bound function \(\beta(x)\).
  • global_error_tolerance (float) –
  • interpolation_kind (str) – The type of interpolation to use. As the kind option of scipy.interpolate.interp1d. Defaults to 'cubic'.
  • max_iterations (int) – The maximum number of iterations to use. If None, iteration will not stop unless the global_error_tolerance is satisfied. Defaults to None.
  • smoothing_factor (float) – The smoothing factor used to combine the current guess with the new guess at each iteration. Defaults to 0.5.
